FuncDef:
The hardware export interval command configures the interval for reporting entries in the hardware flow table.
The undo hardware export interval command restores the default interval for reporting entries in the hardware flow table. The hardware export interval command configures the interval for reporting entries in the hardware flow table. The undo hardware export interval command restores the default interval for reporting entries in the hardware flow table. By default, the interval for reporting entries in the hardware flow table is 10 ms. This command is supported only on the CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE8850-SAN, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P and CE8850-HAM.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the interval for reporting entries in the hardware flow table.
The value is an integer ranging from 5 to 100, in milliseconds. The default value is 10.

ExtraInfo: Hardware-based flow entries generated for traffic collected by the device need to be reported to the chip built in the CPU for further processing. You can run this command to set a proper reporting interval. When the reporting interval expires, flow entries will be reported to the chip built in the CPU.
